thread.title: Spanish firm to build airport in BoliviaTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Spanish firm to build airport in BoliviaTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Spanish firm to build airport in BoliviaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Spanish firm to build airport in Bolivia Published on : Friday, September 18, 2015
The Spanish firm Contratas Iglesias has entered into a contract with the government of Bolivia for the construction of an airport in the eastern province of Santa Cruz. San Ignacio de Velasco is currently served by a tiny airport equipped with a dirt airstrip.
The new terminal will have a runway 3,000 meters (9,835 ft.) long made of flexible pavement and a 12,600-sq. meter (129,000-sq. foot) platform, according to the state run ABI news agency. It will be designed to be capable of accommodating international flights.
San Ignacio de Velasco lies 456 kilometers (283 miles) northeast of Santa Cruz, which boasts Boliviaâ€™s largest international airport, Viru Viru.
San Ignacio de Velasco is a popular tourist destination mostly because of its religious and cultural heritage. It is near to the internationally renowned Noel Kempff Mercado nature reserve.
The signing in ceremony was attended by Bolivia President Evo Morales.
